title: Almanac: Retrieval-Augmented Language Models for Clinical Medicine. (arXiv:2303.01229v2 [cs.CL] UPDATED)
abstract: Large-language models have recently demonstrated impressive zero-shot capabilities in a variety of natural language tasks such as summarization, dialogue generation, and question-answering. Despite many promising applications in clinical medicine, adoption of these models in real-world settings has been largely limited by their tendency to generate incorrect and sometimes even toxic statements. In this study, we develop Almanac, a large language model framework augmented with retrieval capabilities for medical guideline and treatment recommendations. translated_title: Almanac: 检索增强的临床医学语言模型
translated_abstract: 最近，大型语言模型已经在各种自然语言任务中展示出令人印象深刻的零-shot能力，例如摘要、对话生成和问答。虽然在临床医学中有许多有前途的应用，但这些模型在实际环境中的应用往往受到它们生成错误甚至有时是有害言论的限制。在本研究中，我们开发了Almanac，这是一个带有检索能力的大型语言模型框架，用于医疗指南和治疗建议。由5名董事会认证和住院医师评估的130个临床场景的新数据集的表现表明，在所有专业领域中，事实性显著提高（在p值<0.05的情况下增加了18%的平均值），并改善了完备性和安全性。我们的结果表明，大型语言模型有潜力成为临床决策过程中有效的工具，同时也强调了正确性的重要性。
tldr: Almanac是一个带有检索能力的大型语言模型框架，为临床医学的指南和治疗建议提供了事实性、完备性和安全性的增强。该模型有望成为临床决策过程中的有效工具。
en_tdlr: Almanac is a retrieval-augmented large language model framework for medical guideline and treatment recommendations, which provides improvements in factuality, completeness, and safety. This model has potential to be an effective tool in the clinical decision-making process.
